content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `find`. It computes median over arbitrary array. Provide an example

Here is the `find` function in Julia that calculates the median of an array:

```julia
function find(arr)
    n = length(arr)
    if n % 2 == 0
        return (arr[n/2] + arr[(n/2)+1])/2
    else
        return arr[div(n,2)+1]
    end
end
```

Here's an example:

```julia
arr = [3, 6, 9, 12, 15]
println("Median: ", find(arr))
```

When you run this code, it will print the median of the array `[3, 6, 9, 12, 15]`.
